page.title: 01Market Drayton
page.content: Market Drayton is a market town covering the SE quarter of the block.It is a commuter town with many people commuting to nearby large towns.It has a compact shopping centre with new and old buildings. Wednesday, market day,and Saturday are the busiest days.There are large private estates at NE and SW ends of the town.The council estates are scatte- red about the town with large estates in Little Drayton.To the South of the town is the Tern Valley which has proved a natural barrier to development.The A53 trunk road splits the area from the NE to SW corners.A 3km by-pass carries passing traffic, avoiding the narrow town centre streets. The remains of the station and disused railway tracks are all that is left of the railways. Dairy and arable farms surround the town.
